title: Yasuo discussion
body:
**Topic: _Should a champion that is able to get kills so easily ALSO be able to farm so well?_**

Being both an assassin/bruiser and a champ that clears a whole wave with a single E/Q (and sacrifices no cooldowns or mana to do so), gives him a huge gold advantage compared with other champs that are either good at getting kills like Fizz, or good at farming like Karthus.

If a Fizz or Karthus is behind, its fairly simple to keep them behind, Fizz wont do enough damage to get kills and so misses out on gold, while Karthus needs to farm and so will be absent from team fights. But when a Yasuo is behind, it takes next to nothing for him to get back in the game as a formidable force once again.

This is not a Yasuo hate post, its a genuine discussion about should a tanky assassin be able to clear waves so easily, any half-decent Yasuo ends the game with 300+ farm (usually 100 or so more than most everyone else) and it doesn't really affect the number of time they spend getting kills. Most other champions have to actively put time aside to farm to get a similar amount, which of course means less time fighting. Is it fair/balanced/healthy that some champs (Yasuo in particular) can farm so incredibly easily, and still be a champ that can gets kills so frequently (and escape, so isn't wasting gold by being dead).

Most assassins have to get kills to keep up in gold, while other champs such as Mages and ADC's can afford to be better farmers because they don't have the kits to get kills as frequently or as constantly. Yasuo has both, and it always gives him the gold advantage.

I believe that all people who commonly play champions such as Fiora, Yasuo, Riven and Lee Sin are usually playing them for the same reason; because they are brain dead easy to play, and not many people know how to counter them properly.

The easiest counter to them, is not dying to them. That said, simply sitting under tower for the first 15 minutes of a game just because the enemy champion can 100 - 0 you with a Dorans Blade and a couple item ingredients is incredibly counter intuitive. Every other champion in the game has glaringly obvious strengths, weaknesses and counter play.

Up against Xerath or Ziggs? Dodge skill shots and take advantage of their low mobility.
Up against Renekton or Darius? Stay away from them, and farm while their abilities are on cool down.
Up against Nasus or Tryndamere? Take advantage of their weak early game and try to kill them before they become strong.

Up against Yasuo, Fiora, Riven or Lee Sin? Might as well just play a different game for 20 minutes because you sure as hell aren't gonna have any fun whatsoever in this lane.

They are stronger than other champions simply because they have fewer weaknesses.

At this point I personally don't think his damage is the problem, if they try to target that for a nerf they could potentially ruin him, its the fact that he can have a 0.1 second dash. I've noticed a lot from laning against him that his poke potential is insane. Even using champs such as teemo I was unable to equally trade back with him as he could dash in and dash out faster then the amount of damage I needed to do to him for an equal trade. Now a 1.33 second q is fine but having 0.1 seconds on a dash is allowing Yasuo too much free "space" to use at his will. Any fed Yas thrives in fighting multiple opponents/chasing down targets in lanes where he gets 7+ free dashes adding on the amount of opponents he is facing (which usually in a fed Yas matter is 3 or 4). Going even further by allowing him to dash every 0.1 seconds means Yasuo literally moves like the wind and can enter a fight quickly, execute a target, then dash out and maybe if he's lucky a minion wave will be coming and it's bye bye yas because he's outa there. Now most might think because he's squishy dashing into a fight all the time like that is risky but nevermind that anymore with Yas players just building tanky items entering in against 3 or 4 opponents is fine. 

TL;DR - Nerfing Yas Q could potentially ruin him, having a free dash on 0.1 seconds is giving him too much "free space". What I possibly suggest is simply to change his dash CD to be 0.5 seconds at all levels? I believe it would tone him down enough to be balanced since he would still have a good amount of mobility and his damage is still there.
